alert.note: Alert for Somerset (Pennsylvania) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Advisory issued January 01 at 7:20PM EST until January 04 at 1:00PM EST by NWS State College
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 930 PM EST THIS EVENING... * WHAT...Urban and small stream flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected. * WHERE...A portion of central Pennsylvania, including the following county, Somerset. * WHEN...Until 930 PM EST. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. Rises in small streams and creeks. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 720 PM EST, Doppler radar and automated rain gauges indicated heavy rain. This will cause urban and small stream flooding. Between 1.5 and 2 inches of rain have fallen. - Additional rainfall of 0.2 to 0.5 inch is expected over the area. This additional rain will result in minor flooding. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Somerset, Meyersdale, Berlin, Ursina, New Centerville, Mount Davis, Rockwood, Confluence, Salisbury, Garrett, Addison, Wellersburg, Casselman, Callimont and Seven Springs. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Be especially cautious at night when it is harder to recognize the dangers of flooding.
